info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:50PM EDT until August 05 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL PITTSYLVANIA COUNTY AND THE CITY OF DANVILLE... At 550 PM EDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms that produced heavy rain has closed a few roads in the City of Danville, mainly along Pumpkin Creek. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen this evening. Flash flooding and street flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danville... Westover Hills... Ringgold... This includes the following streams and drainages... Childress Creek, Lawless Creek, Hogans Creek, Cane Creek and Dan River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
